At least you have make it so you cant see from outer space that they are made from reinforcements bars*****POSSIBLE SPOILER IS OUT*****.Frankly, everything in this movie is just sad. Actually you do feel sorry for the poor filmmakers who probably tried to do a good funny comedy. Well, it is funny (not 'coz of the plot) but it still ain't good. Anyway, you might as well see this movie if you want a lesson in bad film-making. But if you are a person who just likes to see good movies and want entertainment you don't want to see this movie. Its just disturbing and bad.It's Tremendous!! It's Stupendous!! It's just sad!!

Was Comin' To New Yawk City As Her-cu-les, Ja? This was Auh-nulled Schwarzenegger during his early days.Before "The Terminator..." Before "Jingle All The Way..." Before he became the governor of California...He starred...in very not-well-known films. This movie was one of them. I know "Pumping Iron" was another such example, but this review focuses on "Hercules in New York." I don't want to give out too much detail; I just want y'all to go watch this movie so that you, too, can experience the excitement that are known as...early Auh-Nauld Schwarzenegger movies!

reviews.review_title: Started from the bottom now we here
reviews.content: Is it really that bad? Yes. It is.The version they currently have streaming on Amazon Prime (it's April 2020, one month into the global quarantine) is the version that was otherwise unavailable throughout history. It is the version with the original audio with Arnold's voice. Now, I don't want to have to watch this movie again, but I at least need to see some of the version with the voice dubs at some point - all of the 10/10 reviews I've seen are of people being stoked about how bad the voiceovers are. I feel like I've missed out.That aside, this movie fully sucks. I found it quite endearing for the first 20-30 minutes. It was quirky and cute, and fun to see Arnold give his acting debut, but after 30 minutes... there's almost no cohesive story at all, and the co-star ARNOLD STANG as PRETZY THE PRETZEL GUY, who is in almost every scene, is UNBEARABLE. He's like a cartoon version of Woody Allen who tries to be funny but isn't, ever. There are a couple standout scenes, like when Hercules fights "a bear" in Central Park, LOL.... but, The last hour is VERY difficult to enjoy. It just meanders and even Arnold can't save it. I guess I understand why Arnold wouldn't allow this movie to be played on broadcast television, ever.

This has got to be the funniest movie ever!!!!!!!Arnie obviously hadn't learned proper English yet, so his voice is never heard, instead they used someone else's voice, how lame. The bear scene in the park is a killer, I laughed so hard , my cheeks started to hurt, I'm laughing right now, as I'm writing this -DEAD FUNNY, but overlooked, (OK it's made very poorly and you just shouldn't pay any attention to the story , but considering it's was supposed to be a serious movie the effect is even greater. Rated as a serious movie 1/5 rated as a comedy 5/5Recommendations: if you're having a day when you want to pee your pants because of laughing hard...well, it might just work with this movie

"Hercules in New York", the first movie to star Arnie, kind of makes you wonder how the guy ever got a movie career going. It certainly isn't due to the makers of this movie.This "movie" has amateurism written all over it. The plot (if you can call it that) is dumb and pointless beyond belief and seems like it has been ripped from a (bad) cartoon show. The movie is full of errors (Greek mythological names are confused with Roman names) and emberassing signs of amateurism (the lightning bolts thrown by Zeus are bent pieces of iron, New York traffic can be heard in the background in scenes that apparently take place on Mount Olympus). The action scenes are laughable (expect to see the worst-looking bear suit ever) and none of the actors can even act the slightest bit (just watch the facial expressions of "Pretzy").
I think that nobody who made this train wreck of a movie had any idea of what they were doing. This movie is a failure in every aspect, except that it's actually so bad that it becomes unintentionally funny again.
NO STARS, but definitely worth a look

Oh my god, this movie was horrible.. Possibly the worst I've ever seen. But at the same time, it was the greatest comedy ever.If you consider the movie as a serious piece of some directors pie, it truly earns it's place at the bottom 100. Most of the time during this movie, a thought was knocking in the back of my head: "Were they seriously trying to make a movie?" I guess they were. The directing, acting, special effects.. mein gott! The acting is so bad, that it makes you squirm in your seat. Arnold is trying soo hard to remember his lines, that most of the time it shows on his face. I guess they just needed a big muscular dude to walk around NY and reading a few lines.And the banjo... Ooooh the banjo.. My god make it stop! The banjo is played during all of the action scenes, and it's almost always the same tune. In the beginning it makes you laugh when you hear it, but when the movie is halfway through, you start to tear your hair out because of it.But when not watched seriously, this movie is so hilarious, that I almost crapped my pants in many of the scenes. One of the first lines that Aahnuld says always gets me:"Let me be ze judge of dat, I am tired of ze zame old facez, ze zame old zings!" - Dear Christ Jesus help me Lord that accent is damn thick. Sometimes you can't even totally understand what he's saying.If you are to watch this movie, don't watch it seriously. I also recommend to watch it with friends, and maybe a couple of cold ones, and I'll bet that it'll crack you up.For the crew's serious intentions to make a good movie, and utterly failing., I'll give this movie 1/10. But, because the movie is so bad that it actually becomes good, I'll give this one 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Watchable for just one evident reason
reviews.content: The fact that this ridiculous movie is to be seen is the fact that Arnold Schwarzenegger plays in it,even more so,it's his screen debut. And what a laugh!The man is totally failing in every aspect of acting and his speech is so bad that it becomes absolutely funny.That's where the charm of this movie lies cause in every other way it is a bad 90 minutes of celluloid.The story sucks,the acting is worse and the camera-work is terrible.Nevertheless,a must see for everyone who wants to know something about cinema and it's rather strange history.We had to wait another 10 years before Arnie came back in a big way with Conan the Barbarian.Cinema history,for sure,although it will never be written down in any book about the subject.

reviews.review_title: I hope "The Governator" has forgotten this one
reviews.content: Arnold's acting debut came in a period in his life when I guess bodybuilding was his main interest. I certainly hope so, for he acts so bad in this movie that it's torture to sit through it. Bad acting from one person only doesn't necessary make a movie a total disaster, but when just EVERYTHING ELSE also are as horrible as they can be, then we have a movie that never should've been made. Here, I'll mention a few things that I especially noticed as bad: In the fight at the wharf, you clearly see that the people who get pushed into the water stops at the edge, and then jumps into the water themselves. I guess they just found some workers at a ship nearby and offered them a dime each to take part in this scene. The bear in the park was so badly made that you have to see it to believe it In the scenes with the Greek gods at the Olymp, you often hear car horns in the background. Tip to all future movie makers: When shooting a movie with Greek gods in their home, DO NOT PLACE THE SET NEXT TO A HIGHWAY.This flick is only suitable for die hard-fans of muscle-flexing and bad German accents. Everybody else, Arnold-fans included, should avoid this movie at all costs.

Hercules in New York is without doubt one of the worst films ever made. Arnie makes his film debut as Hercules in a film so unimaginably cheap that you can actually hear the traffic in the scenes filmed in a park! It really is that cheap! The storyline really doesn't matter, the film is just a series of Arnie gets made, Arnie hits or throws someone scenes, all of them done with no authenticity whatsoever. Yet the film is brilliant. Why? Well its so bad its good, as many cheap films are. The soundtrack can only be described as 'Greek plate throwing music'. The supporting cast are all diabolical, save for Pretzie, a dwarf like New Yorker who for some reason becomes Arnie's buddy and follows him round everywhere. Pretzie has to be seen to be believed, his squeaky voice alone is worth hours of laughter. The 'special effects' for want of a better phrase are awful, but this adds plenty of character to the film. Much of the action defies belief. If you enjoy terrible films for their comic value then watch this! Try and get the original undubbed version, Arnie's Austrian accent is so amazingly strong that you will genuinely struggle to understand what he is saying. But this all adds to the fun! Overall a stunning display of comedy!

If you haven't seen Arnies first film, made when he was 21, you haven't lived.Playing the titular hero, Hercules descends on New York and that's about it. But the fun is watching inept direction, some truly awful acting, a terrible script and on existent production values.Pitched as a comedy, I didn't laugh once such is the puerile nature of this film. The low budget is obvious (such as the scenes supposedly set in Olympus complete with the sound of New York traffic in background due to the fact they filmed it in Central Park) . And there are two versions of the film, one with Arnold's real voice and one with it dubbed into an American accent.This film is a real curio, like a prototype Crocodile Dundee tale of a fish out of water, but missing that films quality. However its still entertaining but harmless kiddie friendly trash and worth a watch.Oh, and if Arnold Stang, who plays Pretzie, sounds familiar thats because he's the voice of Top Cat from television.Enjoy yourself.

Hercules in New York is my favourite bad movie of all time. Here's why I think it's a work of absolute genius.The perfect cast - you get Arnie as a Greek god, he's got the body for it but not the accent and if you think he sounds a bit Austrian these days you should hear him back when this movie was made. Other great casting includes the poor man's Woody Allen and the goddess of beauty being a bit, well rough to put it bluntly.The exotic location - what a stroke of genius filming the entire movie in and around central park during rush hour! The blaring sound of car horns definitely sets the scene for a far off mystical paradise. What I especially liked is the way in one scene Zeus glares at the sound of the sound of traffic like he's just about had it and is going to snap. The speech about the peace and tranquillity of Olympus being drowned out by the sound of traffic is a nice touch too.The action - the tagline for this movie invites you to "See Him Topple Two Ton Newspaper Rolls!", I'm not sure about two tons but newspaper rolls are indeed toppled so you can't complain there. In fact there are lots of "oh look, he's really strong" moments with the poor man's Woody Allen simpering over our heroes ample muscles. So funny, though strangely the laughter dies when the film tries to crack a few gags.The bear - I saved the best to last. Arnie gets attacked by a guy in a really cheap bear suit, possibly a pervert. In this scene the guy in the bear suit is met with two immediate challenges - 1) how can I stop this pitiful bear suit from falling off me and 2) The strongest man in the universe is beating the crap out of me with rather too much enthusiasm like maybe he doesn't realise this is just acting.Brilliant fun from start to finish, probably one of the funniest bad movies ever - If I ever feel sad I watch this film, it always works.
The bear scene was amazing and the actor Arnold is the best in the world! Amazing plot twist and very intense!

reviews.review_title: They tried to make a serious film, and made a hilarious comedy...
reviews.content: Ever heard the phrase, "it's so bad that it's good?" Well whoever said that never saw Hercules in New York.You know the different factors one takes when analysing a film? Direction, acting, casting, editing, sound editing, cinematography, screenplay, etc. I don't think this movie has any of these factors.It would be very tempting to say that this is the worst movie ever made, but Gangs of New York beats this comedy by a country mile in those stakes. Gangs of New York has to be the worst film ever created. If you want to waste three hours of your life when you could be painting a black wall black again, then watching it dry, watch Gangs of New York.Hercules in New York is a comedy, and should be viewed as such. If you've bought it for a couple of quid/bucks/yen/euros, and you've got a bunch of stoner friends round for a sesh on the pipe, tell them that this is a comedy, and they'll believe you. I found it hilarious. It taught me nothing about film, but its complete and utter shite-ness generated more laughs than a night at a comedy club - so in some respects, it is genius. Enjoy, but don't even think about taking it seriously.

Heads up to anyone who is interested in or has a weakness for this endearingly stinky piece of cheese from 1970.  There is a DVD available now that includes Arnold's original voice track, with his dialog delivered in the thickest Austrian accent imaginable.  Happily, the badly dubbed replacement voice is also included in an additional track.  Both are terrible, and hilarious.  Check it out, and get it while you can.

There is only one reason to see this movie and it is not the wonderful Governor of California...it is the small Jewish sidekick that makes this movie a masterpiece, one for the ages...my man PRETZI!!! That's right, the man is the epitome of the Jewish New Yorker and I have never seen a more lifelike portrayal of one since in a movie. In fact, he does not even need to speak at all. His amazed facial expressions during the scene where Hercules throws the discus and then the javelin are moving and touching. I love when that man opens his mouth in astonishment. It is too bad that he did not make any more substantial films, most likely because he was just fed up with stardom. Pretzi is a film character that will live on throughout the ages and Arnold would not have the fame that he does today without the amazing portrayal of Pretzi by the true Arnie, Arnold Stang.

reviews.review_title: An excellent movie - if you just want to kill some time
reviews.content: This is NOT a great movie. This is NOT a movie with excellent actor-performances. BUT this is a classic. Imagine, You are at home, having nothing to do and you know that you ain't up for a movie with a lot of action, a lot of comedy, a drama or a thriller - you just want to lose an hour and a half doing nothing important. Then this is the movie for you. This is one of the movies that actually is so bad that it is good. And the best part - nothing in this movie is correct with the original mythology of Greece.

This is my first review so bear with me. I am an Arnold freak so I just had to watch it when it was on late night WGN. It was neat to see Arnie in his first role. Now I will admit it, it is a strange movie but it is funny at times. Arnie's dubbed voice is just retarded. The part when Arnie first comes to Earth is funny. So if you are an Arnold fan give it a look, and if you aren't it's totally up to you. Movie wise  4/10 Arnie wise 4/10

Okay, I first heard about this movie when it was reviewed on Cinematic Excrement, an online show that I enjoy very much. Then one day, I was walking down the aisles of Walgreens when I saw this in their DVD selection. I had no money at the time, so I didn't get it. Then, in May, I was walking down the aisles of Walgreens, but this time, I had four bucks to kill! So instead of blowing it on candy, I blew it on this movie, and it was a four bucks worth blowing. This film is very enjoyably bad. Arnold's acting is very wooden, and I always make fun of the way he says "Hercules". The budget looks very TV movie-Esq. I love Zeus, even though he looks like he really doesn't want to be in this movie. I love how the fight scenes are barely fight scenes, they're either pushing or tossing. The editing is very bad, as well, mainly the scene where Hercules is showing off his "mad" Olympic-like skills. We see him jump, then people with wide-opened mouths, and then Arnold land.It's a shame that this movie isn't celebrated like the way I do. It should be worshiped for how bad it is, like Plan 9 or Manos. I say, whenever there's a new movie about Herc coming on TV or to theaters, forget that and pop in this flick!

I finally got around to seeing this movie, mainly for the sake of seeing the Governator's first movie.*shudder*I've never felt like I've lost a significant portion of my brain while watching a movie before.Don't get me wrong, I'm a huge Arnie fan, I love most of his movies. Even the bad ones. *cough* Red Sonja *cough*But I couldn't find any redeeming features in this one. Let's all just be glad that movies like this are rare, and that Arnie has definitely come a long way since then.Though I did keep expecting John Cleese to come in feeling all peckish, and proceed to start trying to purchase some cheese. Compliments to the bazouki playing throughout most of the movie.Still... wasn't as bad as Manos.

For a long time I didnt get the Arnold thing, and then I saw "Pumping Iron". Arnold rules!  The one and only original Strongman.  Nobody compares. Arnold is the undisputed greatest athlete of all time.  And as far as I am concerned he cannot do wrong.  Most actors ar phony balonies.  Arnold is the real deal.  I myself am a former US Marine, a 5th degree black belt.  And I think Arnold is number one in this movie he's simply true to form.  ZTo the Arnold purist this movie is number one.

I never ever thought I would get to watch movie here in India because this movie is really one of the earliest movies of ARNIE. Anyway, if you get to watch this movie please keep your brains aside and watch. This is CRAZY and really really makes you laugh. (Especially, watch the fight between Hercules and the Bear. Boy, that's crazy comic stuff.)

reviews.review_title: Make certain you see the ORIGINAL version
reviews.content: The first released version had all of Arnold's lines dubbed! Apparently they thought that his heavy accent wouldn't make it. The only version I've had the luck to see was the ORIGINAL with his voice. It's obvious that they knew he was to be dubbed out from the way he just (boringly) says his lines, no emotion, no feeling, just words.... of course it MIGHT be that he really WAS trying, but <shrug> he just wasn't an actor!Obviously that's changed now! What a way to start a career, and am I glad he did it! All of his recent movies are GREAT. This one is a good one to see, if just to see really how far he's come!Keep in mind the era, and don't laugh too hard at the fake fighting. :-)

reviews.review_title: Scores highly on So Bad It's Good scale
reviews.content:
Arnold Schwarznegger (whom you've heard about) and Arnold Stang (whom you probably haven't heard about) is certainly among the most (unintentionally?) funny comedy duos in film history... Stang manages the most awfully hilarious facial expressions while Schwarznegger has none at all in this early stage of his acting career, giving the no brains only muscle stereotype a (false) play here.Other highlights:
THE BEAR vs ARNOLDAn incredibly annoying music loop on repeat throughout the film.

Those who have already seen this film automatically know how bad this film really is. I would like to let others know how much i would like to stress to you never to watch this film.WARNING:once you have seen this film you will never get back those precious wasted minutes in your lifeArnie still cant act for toffee (and everyone wants toffee). His struggling English mixed with confusion about whats actually going on is amazing the film was ever made entirely.The poor costume and cheap settings let alone the pointless crap story.... i mean WHAT were you thinking , i mean REALLY.....What a waste of money!THIS IS A MESSAGE GOING OUT TO THE CREATERS OF 'HERCULES IN NEWYORK' AND ALL THAT WAS INVOLVED.....you make me SICK!!!If it were up to me i would scrap the film from existence, and attempt to redeem any pride from the Hollywood industry......its a MUST SEE

This is on my list of the greatest bad movies ever, right up there with Robot Monster. Perhaps the funniest thing about it is that Arnold Stang seems like a really big star compared to everything around him -- his performance is the most professional thing in the movie.

The first 30 ish minutes of this movie are worth the watch. You get; Arnold in a sailors suit and cap, Arnold doing track and field, Arnold fighting a man in a bear costume in central park. When the mob shows up you could probably quit the movie. Also after this mark you have to endure another full hour of Pretzie and his stupid face, voice and all the other bulls**t that is Pretzie. Arnold's bits are worth the watch in the first leg of the movie then he gets phased out throughout the movie to include useless plot points and Pretzie. Give it a watch I guess, you won't enjoy it but you may get a few laughs in the first 20-30 minutes.

The movie was kinda stupid, but Arnold S. looked SPECTACULAR! (or should that be PEC-tacular?!) I recommend this flick to everyone who enjoys seeing a man with a magnificent body. Maybe the film wouldn't win an award, but Arnold's bod deserves a thousand awards!

reviews.review_title: Great movie but do not expect the most professional
reviews.content: A rather cheaply made movie, but a good storyline and interesting to see Arnold Schwarzenegger in his first film role. There is some rather poor acting by the women on Mount Olympus, actually I think they were not even actresses, but overall the film is fun to watch. I did find it rather odd though, that in almost the last scene, with Zeus on his throne, that there was significant background noise from passing traffic. I think that scene was an afterthought, as they did not film it in the beautiful gardens they used for Mount Olympus earlier. It was just a throne stuck in a small park somewhere in New York with lots of traffic noise in the background, which was very obvious. Worth watching if you want a lightweight fun film without expecting anything professional or a big budget. Or just to see Arnie's first acting role. I did hear somewhere that his voice was dubbed for this, but it seems as if it was mostly his real voice, except at the end on the radio, when the man is listening he thinks it is Hercules speaking but the voice is totally different to Arnie's. At various times his voice did sound like someone else's, but mostly it sounded like Arnie's voice.

Arnold's föerst movie is a "must-see" for every Arnold fan on the planet.You shall not see this movie if you want to be stimulated intellectually, but instead see it and be enjoyed by it. I think this movie is so cool because Arnold seems so stupid and it is sometimes hysterically funny. Some moments in the movies makes it all worth to see it.The plot is kinda weird and the lasts scenes is very hard to understand, but still the entertainment is in frontseat.Of course is it primitive and the dialogs are stupid but it is cult! The whole idea with this film is (to my opinion) to gather with your best arnie-friends, buy a lot of beers and then see it. Trust me, that will be the event of the year.I'm out

reviews.review_title: Bad acting except by the pects
reviews.content: Let's see: acting? Can't even understand what he says! Brainless plot, bad camerawork. Hmm, forget the acting, Arnold. Let's make you governor, where you won't be able to harm anybody-- oh, maybe not.

Arnold Schwarzenegger, now the Governor of California, started his illustrious movie career in this film. He was credited as Arnold Strong, because it was suggested that it would be a more suitable name for him.Hercules in New York is the story of a man born of the gods who travels from Mount Olympus to New York due to his current lack of excitement. He instead finds a female companion and ends up with a rival in the form of a fellow body-builder.The most important thing to remember when watching this film is that you must not take it seriously. Arnold obviously was still perfecting his use of the English language (some argue that he has yet to do so) and his errors make for the some of the films funniest scenes. The film is supposed to be comedic, as shown by the track and field events, but it's Arnold who makes the film as funny as it is. No film can be so bad it's funny, because laughter is evidence of enjoyment. It's one of those films you love to hate. Definitely one for a rainy day!LOOK OUT FOR: The boyfriend of Arnold's female companion. He was also the track and field contender and seems to take losing in sport (and perhaps love) pretty well!LOOK OUT FOR: The bear. Made the film cheaper than you could ever think possible.

I have given this movie a vote of 1. This is because I have voted using the same criteria for all of my other votes. This truly is a terrible film if somebody sits down and takes it seriously. However, the majority of people who watch this film watch it for its comic value. This is not a film that you laugh at because it contains good jokes or satire, this is a film that you laugh at! It is so cheaply made and the cheesiest thing ever! The highlight of the film is definitely when Hercules (Arnie) dukes it out with a "600 pound Grizzly bear". Hmmmmmm, well this grizzly bear must be a kick boxing one because i swear he puts up his guard ready to take on the mighty Hercules! Other highlights include the traffic noises and aeroplane noises in the heavenly land of Olympus! Oh and when a god that can fly chooses to ride in a helicopter, classic! I recommend that this film be watched if you fancy a right good laugh or you are seriously drunk!

reviews.review_title: Lower your standards to sea level, and this is Steven Speilberg
reviews.content: True, this movie is as lame as you can get. But hey, give Arnie some credit! This was his FIRST movie. He didn't know what the hell he was doing! The material is cheap and grossly unoriginal and the SFX are unbelievably fake looking. You should watch this because it is a true peice of Schwarzenegger history. It is actually quite funny and very watchable. Don't expect quality, but you can expect a few good laughs. 1 of 5 stars.

reviews.review_title: Got to see this movie ONCE!!!
reviews.content: This film is bad, bad, BAD The plot, the props, the stunts, the action sequences are all chronic in there absolute patheticness. The acting is even worse, and Arnies voice is dubbed. By gosh, if you had to introduce Arnie into the movie world, couldn't the producer and director at least have ATTEMPTED to make it reasonable?!?!Having said this, if you're an Arnie fan, you may well find this highly amusing nostalgia.  If there is ANY benifit in this rediculous flick, is that you may get a great laugh out of it, and may even want the DVD so you get a good laugh with your friends.This movie was done when Arnie was current in the world record book as the "most perfectly developed man in human history". (Quote: Guiness book of records)I gave it 1/10.  But I would be tempted to give it more if you are turned on by sentimental starting points and/or movies for now famous movie stars

reviews.review_title: Essential Viewing (but not for the right reasons)
reviews.content: I saw this for three quid on a web site once and couldn't resist. I'm not a fan of "bad movies", but I'd seen clips of this on television and it looked like an interesting debut for Arnie.The clips I'd seen were dubbed by some American actor, which looks ridiculous now that Arnie has become so established. However the DVD only had the original Schwarzenegger soundtrack, which proved to be just as ridiculous. People complain about Arnold's accent now? It was so thick in this film, backed up with terrible acting (made his performance in "Commando" look Oscar-worthy), it's no wonder he was dubbed. You can barely understand a thing he says. As terrible as this is though, it's one of the main reasons to see this.The concept of the film is ridiculous, it perhaps could've worked if it didn't take itself so seriously (ironically, it wouldn't have been as funny though). The thing that really disturbs me is that human beings conjured up this film, adult human beings. They wrote it, it was approved, people agreed to have a part in it, it was directed, it was shot, it was acted, it was edited, it was released, and people actually watched it.I only watched it once in its entirety, and that took a few sittings (despite its short length). It is mostly a very tedious experience. Thankfully there are some stand-out scenes that are absolutely (and unintentionally) hilarious. The bear wrestling scene for instance, it was like something from a Monty Python sketch. I found scenes like this were actually worth re-visiting, and the only reason anyone would want to keep this in their collection. I later sold it though, it just had no place on my shelf.Of course this film would be so much easier to dismiss (probably less ridiculous, and even more tedious), if it weren't for Arnie. It is the fact that he has since been cemented as one of the biggest movie stars of all time, and this is where he started. Although he'd already established himself as a body builder at this point, he continued to win more contests, became a huge international movie star, is now the governor of California, and might even be President one day, all with a thick Austrian accent. Looking at "Hercules in New York" is a reminder, there's hope for us yet. 2/10

reviews.review_title: it has to be seen to be believed
reviews.content: I was torn between scoring this 1 and 10. It is an amazing film on so many different levels.The bear scene is like the worst pantomime. The young Arnie is monosyllabic. Yet this film has a charm that possibly even the cast and crew didn't recognise. You can't deny that Arnie has an amazing physique.It's a(n) homage to New York and a reflection of the late 20th Century It is some of the worst acting you will ever see and there is a total absence of decent special effects.So bad it's good, see it now!

When I first heard about this movie, it sounded to good to be true. A movie about Hercules going to New York, featuring Arnold Schwarzenegger in his first lead role and if that was not enough - not at a single time in this movie do you hear his voice. His English was so bad that they actually dubbed him through the entire movie.I went to my favourite videostore and was thrilled to find it, and I was not disappointed. I won´t go into detail about the plot, but I can reveal that this was truly a masterpiece. It tells the classic story about a man who goes on a quest to find himself and to be reunited with his true love, and on his way he has to overcome various obstacles to reach his goal. What more can you possibly ask for?If your a fan of movies made that are made by people who truly believe in their work, if your an Arnold enthusiast, if you were touched by Titanic, if you love action scenes where the film makers have used the forward button to create the effect of a car driving fast - then this movie will be guaranteed a top spot on your personal top ten! In other words if your a b-movie fanatic, do not miss this movie!

reviews.review_title: Its fantastic. Its Stupendous. Its crap.
reviews.content: After being recommended by some school chums, I decided to trot along to Woolworth's and invest £1 into the film known as "Hercules In New York". Now, I want you all to know there is an insane amount of quotes that can be used again and again in real life. "I Don't have any money!" "Insolence!" "It doesn't even look like me!" "That'll teach you respect for your elders!" "But Hercules doesn't need any money!" "Haha! You have Struck Hercules!" "Fine Chariot, but where are your horses?"The film begins in the secret gardens of Olympus (located in a public park in new york, complete with New York Traffic sounds and its own camera crew). Hercules asks his father, Zeus, to let him go down to earth for no reason what-so-ever. His father instantly gets so ticked off that he decides to throw a plastic wand at him and Hercules instantly gets sent to earth. Now the script gets interesting.Hercules flies past a window (and an old granny gets turned on) of a plane, and then falls into the sea, which is bizarre, as he was flying a few seconds ago.Zeus sends help and Boom! Hercules is picked up by a boat. He gets off the boat. Then, he decides to beat up everyone and pushes a man into the water (well, he gives him a shove and the actor does a dramatic leap of faith into the water.) Then we meet the mistake of the film, a Pratt called Pretzzy.(Arnold Stang). His irritating voice gives you a brain hemorrhage, and you pray that he will get out of the story as soon as possible, but no, he follows "Herc!" around everywhere. He gets a taxi and gives "herc!" a pretzel, which he describes as: "food of Z gods!" Then, he gets dropped off at Central Park, and they cannot pay the driver. So, they get into a bitch-fight and "Herc!" pushes the taxi driver into the bushes.A few minutes of insecure running clips later, he turns up at a sports event, and nothing happens. "Herc!" then gets to go to a gals house and stuff, then nothing happens for another 20 minutes.After that, Hercules takes out the gal for a horse ride through central park, which changes from day to night in a matter of seconds. The next action scene is an amazing Grizzly Bear fight scene.The grizzly bear, which A) Looks like a European Bear fancy dress costume and B) Appears to be living in central park doing no harmsuddenly gets lepta on by Hercules and starts doing a wrestling match, throwing punches at each other and ends up as the gal does a hilariously stupid faint.I hope you enjoyed reading this, for I have waisted too much of my time writing it. I hope you all come to your senses and watch it. If you cant afford it, just go up to the counter and say "I don't have any money...."

This is one hilarious movie! Being Austrian myself I laughed hard at Arnolds thick Styrian accent! Well, this movie is a load of fun! Compared to more recent crap like the Hercules and Xena series this really shines like a sparkling gem! But why do people always mix Hercules with the greek pantheon? Hercules is the son of Jupiter in the Roman pantheon while Herakles is the son of Zeus in the greek pantheon! not that it matters in a movie like this though!

reviews.review_title: Not the worse movie I've ever seen, but real close.
reviews.content: This is such a bad movie it has too be seen, at least once. I'd say it put Arnold's career back 5-8 years. I can't point to one actor that wasn't terrible in this bomb. If Arnold had not made it big we'd have never seen this stinker. I have to hand it to Arnold he took this awful experience and turned it into one of the most inspiring stories in all of Hollywood. Not that he will win any awards, but he at least makes movies I love to watch. Not to mention that he makes a pretty good living doing them. You've come along way Arnold, a true all-American story.

reviews.review_title: lots of laughts... at the film's expense
reviews.content: this film is truly magnificent. there really are parts where you cannot understand what arnie is trying to say. think of the acting in red sonia, add some more wood and you get the standard in this film. go to your local charity shop, collect some materials together, make a camera and that's what they used to film this (i love the background noise of the camera, i feel that particularly adds to the film). that said, the decision to film mount olympus near a main road also adds to the atmosphere. perhaps the most, um, experimental part of the film is its ability to have one scene in both night and day at irregular intervals along with conversations between people where their clothes change halfway through. some of the actors sadly seem to genuinely have believed that this would further their careers, but the lady who pretends to be godzilla when she sees arnie floating at 30,000 feet (i think she was trying to scream, but am still not sure), i think realised that was it for her career, although through a marvellous stroke of genius, she also appears in the trailer. as do all the action scenes, naturally. all four of them. once throwing around cardboard drums (although they're not meant to be cardboard, but they get dented as they hit the ground, what a superb effect), once being hit by a able in a not overly staged stunt, and a couple of times where arnie makes his pecs bounce. there are films which are worse than this, but it certainly had me creasing up, especially at the start. and, yes, you guessed it, not WITH the film...

I didn't really know how to rate this movie. When it comes to the storyline I give it a 1, but when it comes to Arnie I give it a 10! I mean I thought Arnie was stupidly funny in Twins but this one definitely takes the prize!! I once heard that the makers of the movie had dubbed over Arnie's voice because his English was so utterly crap at the time, but I was pleasantly surprised when I bought the DVD because there was an option on whether you wanted Arnie's voice or the dubbed one. So if you haven't seen this one and you plan to see it on DVD, YOU MUST CHOOSE ARNIE'S VOICE! Or you will miss out on all the fun of the movie.Oh, and try to spot Richard Herd who played Supreme Commander John in the sci-fi show "V", he is in there!

So Arnold, straight out of the Mr. Universe contests, plays (what else) a god in this 1970 movie, that gives laugh after laugh after laugh. With hysterically clumsy dialogue ("The way you were staring at me, I thought I had a hair out of place or something of the sort", and "Tea- the conventional social drink!"), honking cars in the background of Olympus, and a short-haired Samson (the biblical Samson, who happened to be summoned by the gods), the enjoyment never wanes.

reviews.review_title: yes it could have been better!
reviews.content: this would have been a better movie had arnold been allowed to speak for himself.  hercules was not an american so he would not have our dialect or speech down to perfect english. he's new in town so give him a break. you know practice makes better not perfect. it's not always the actor or actress' fault that a movie is not up to par. give some of the credit to the writer and director.

reviews.review_title: The greatest Old Movie that has ever existed.
reviews.content: Spoilers may occur here.If i could give a movie 12 out of 10 than it would be this movie. This movie had everything. humour, anger, sadness, cheeriness. The clown scene was the best and when Arny climbed a ladder to reach the sky it was good.It had a bear in it which looked like a chicken and he was always ripping his top off, i reckon he wanted everyone to rub his nipple.Also i was waiting for his catchphrase i'll be back but to no avail did he say it all he said was i am Hercules son of Zeus do u want to rub my nipple.i was wondering where was the teenage ninja turtles and teila from he-man and also rainbow bright and the wuzzles.all in all it was a great movie i'll give it a slice of lemon and a half an orange peel monkey tastic.

reviews.review_title: Early, raw, excellent version of young Arnold
reviews.content: o you know why Arnold is flexing? Because this is the first ever film starring the then- aspiring bodybuilder Arnold Schwarzenegger. In fact, this is the only thing that he is doing the right way in the whole movie-flexing.arnold is flexingArnold's debut motion picture is a raw and hilarious representation of the young version of one of the most successful men in the world.Schwarzenegger's evident lack of on- screen experience make this movie looks more like a documentary on bodybuilding.But first things first.The plot:Taking place back in 1970 when Arnold is still an adolescent, the movie tells us the story of the powerful gods of Olympus- the home of the Greek Gods.The plot centers more on the life of Zeus and mostly on his son Hercules (guess from the first time, which Austrian oak took the role).The young Hercules is spending his glorious but boring adolescence in Olympus- a kingdom far above the clouds among his divine family. One day he decides to disobey his father's will and escapes to earth.There, he is starting to explore things he has never experienced before- he falls in the trap of love and he struggles to become an undisputed bodybuilding champion.The cast:What cast?! Only Arnold is important here. He is also the only known name in the production.In fact, by the time, he was only a young bodybuilder who was trying to make his way to the Hollywood top, just like many other aspiring actors with a certain amount of self-esteem.This is a Funny Action Movie because:Like previously noticed, this is the first Arnold movie ever! He is so inexperienced in acting that you risk to have shortness of breath from laughter while watching the young Austrian desperately trying to be an actor.Originally, Schwarzenegger's voice was dubbed because he barely spoke English at the time. Later, however, when the DVD version was released, his own voice was included in the movie.It won't be far from truth to state that once the DVD version of the film was released, it gained international success. It is just my personal opinion here but I believe that it is due to the fact that then, for the first time, the world heard Arnold's legendary and ridiculous Austrian accent. And that changed everything.The plot is so primitive, the directing so poor and the acting so bad that it hurts. The whole movie is a complete nonsense from the beginning to the very end.It is like someone decided on Tuesday to make a movie and on Wednesday it was all wrapped up and ready to be on screen.The cast is disturbingly inappropriate and the acting is pathetic.But wait!Isn't it exactly what we are looking for? That's right. That is the whole idea of it.It is a sick fun and be sure that it is enjoyable. Arnold's accent is terribly hilarious and God forbid, don't watch this movie dubbed!Just experience Arnold crying out like a five year old retarded child "I am Hercules" a thousand times or "No man is superior to Hercules". The accent, combined with his funny face moves can easily make you go into spasms of laughter.Make sure that you don't miss the part at the beginning of the movie when he complains to his mighty father Zeus that he is "tired of the zame old zings, the same old facezz".At this time, you won't be sure if by the end of the movie Hercules will become bodybuilding champion but somehow you feel that he will definitely win the "who got the most ridiculous accent" competition.The funniest part is when Hercules is walking on the street along with his hot date and spots a bodybuilding competition poster with some tough man on the cover.He immediately goes angry and jealous. With the blink of an eye, he tears up his tight t-shirt and starts flexing his giant muscles in order to prove to his girlfriend that his is the God of the gym. He moves like a wounded panda. It is truly spectacular to observe.Another great scene is the scene with the bear. The extraordinary muscular Schwarzenegger takes his girl on a romantic carriage ride. All of a sudden, a bear comes out of nowhere and stands in front of the carriage roaring loud and menacing the lives of the couple in love.What do you think happens?Arnold jumps off the carriage and starts a spectacular one on one fight with the bear. I won't put spoilers here. I would just mention that the animal activists might get angry.During the whole movie Arnold's expressionless gaze and stiff acting are combined with the boring and inappropriate soundtrack, dramatically dull actors and poor directing. The dialogue is also very, very bad.Conclusion:Not only this is a must-see movie but if you ask me, it even should be included in your bucket list right after the "parachute diving" check off.Seriously, this gem perfectly serves its purpose-to distract you, to make you feel good and to make you laugh no matter if you are an Arnold Schwarzenegger fan or not.www. funny action movies.com

reviews.review_title: Fine family entertainment for a rainy weekend afternoon!
reviews.content: I found this to be an affable and enjoyable film to watch, quite silly and good-natured overall. Both Arnolds (Schwarzenegger and Stang) are fun to watch, and the rest of the cast is okay if not particularly memorable. The original version of the film had another, un-credited actor providing the voice of Arnold's Hercules due to his thick accent, but the DVD version, as well as the version you can catch on TV these days, have restored Arnold's real voice to the soundtrack, which really helps. Overall, it's good fun and if you go into it not expecting too much, you'll emerge at the end having had a pleasant if not unforgettable experience.

reviews.review_title: A Lesson in how a film should be made.
reviews.content: In the modern world of CGI this and stunt double that, it is easy to forget the brilliance a simply made film can achieve. With 18 surprise (so surprising no one even heard about them)nominations for various Oscars back in 1970, Hercules in New York proved that good acting, continuity and most of all an actual plot are entirely disposable in the creation of a movie. The film begins on top of Mt. Olympus where Hercules is pleading with his father to be allowed down to earth. Zeus, however is adamant that Hercules remain on Mt. Olympus, an argument ensues and in his fury Zeus throws a thunderbolt at Hercules, sending him to Earth. Which is exactly what Hercules wanted. Funny that. When upon Earth our noble hero sets about picking fights with people smaller than him, attacking animals and taking up funding from gangsters. He also befriends what many believe to be the most interesting character ever created in cinema-"Pretzie". A lonely soul "Pretzie" (so called because he sells pretzels)wanders the streets of New York alone. Selling pretzels. Many believe the pretzels to be a metaphor for small African children, and Pretzie to be a man dragged into an illegal trade by a society that doesn't care. Had the film been made thirty years later Pretzies main customers would undoubtedly have been Madonna and Angelina Jolie, however this was not the case, and some poignancy is distracted from Pretzie's plight as a result. Hercules in New York also boasts the finest action scene in cinematic history- Hercules versus the Bear, in which our protagonist, upon seeing an escaped bear, decides the best course of action is to beat the living crap out of it in front of his date. The fight can be seen here- http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yQhBGDOO4-w (about 50 seconds in the action starts) To conclude I think we should all try to take on board the meaning of the last line of Pretzies big, final speech: "Yeah. I think- I think I'll have an apple"

reviews.review_title: I hate Schwarzenegger, but I like this movie.
reviews.content: I am not the kind of person who enjoys Arnold Schwarzenegger movies. I find them rather annoying, and I wonder what society has come to when a man with the all-around ineptitude of Schwarzenegger gains the demigodhood moviegoers have known him for. "Hercules in New York" is an exception. Not because it's a good movie--it's definitely horrible. But it does have an unintended laughter quality that redeems it.It's common knowledge that this is Ah-nold's first movie. Fresh off his bodybuilding days but pre-steroid abuse (you can tell these things by looking at him), he is Hercules, half-mortal and half-god son of Zeus, king of the Olympian gods. Well, kinda. There's a crapload of stuff taken from other myths as well. Anyway, Hercules has lived on Mt. Olympus for thousands of years, and is bored. So against Zeus' wishes, he goes down to Earth to have some fun.By now, you gotta be thinking, "what a stupid plot." True. The acting is also mostly, but totally, bad. There's also really bad dialog. And the action scenes look like a the writer based them off a playing session two children had with action figures.But that's the charm. You'll laugh throughout the movie, particularly young Arnold's miserable attempts at acting. It's the kind of movie that you'll laugh at, make fun of, and have a howling good time watching. Particularly when Arnold is driving a chariot and wrestling an obviously fake bear that moves like a gorilla."'Hercules in New York' is the touching tale of an Austrian bodybuilder who thinks he is a Greek demigod. he doesn't fit in, but a little bad dialog and flexing of his body gain him instant adulation."Yeah, that's the kind of bashing you might give this movie.So go get a bag of popcorn, a bag of popcorn, and enjoy this movie. Hey, you should; it spawned a video game for the Nintendo Entertainment System. Agh...

Heh, Heh, Heh:).  One of those classic movies that is so bad that you have to watch it again and again.  Now we can even see this movie with the original audio track.  I can understand what Ahh-Nuld is saying.  Why would they need to dub an Oscar deserving performance like that???? I think I'm going to watch again right now!

Yes, The Oak from Austria (in this movie still known as Arnold Strong) is making his way to the great white screen!His accent at the time was so bad, that the audio-dub of his voice was re-done by some American guy, but lucky me, I got my hands on the original one!I hardly understand a word he's saying, and his annoying gnome-buddy Pretzie isn't doing the job quite well either. This all together makes the movie in means of story hard to follow, and the gods (who all speak perfectly sound English) are not making their point very clear. What is it they want? Do they really care not for our beloved 'Herc', or are we humans just pawns in the sick game of our Olympian overlords?Nice stuff too though, throwing discii, spears, cars, people and riding around in chariots. (which fall apart)A must see, and remember: the Oak will be back!

i went into this film with low expectations...So happy i watched this epic film. As bad as the film is i still found it one of the funniest films I've seen in a long time,the acting is awful, the plot does not really make any sense at all.their is a scene where Arnie is fighting a bear (I'd watch the whole film just for that scene).if you are a fan of Arnie or just bad acting then this is the film for you.this film deserves a higher rating,10/10 comedy.I found myself in a laughing fit every few minutes its that good/bad? I would easily recommend this film to anyone,I'm looking forward to watching it again soon, A MUST SEE FILM!

reviews.review_title: Giving it a 1 rating only to keep this film on the Bottom 100 list
reviews.content: ...But it gets a 10 in terms of entertainment value! One of my favorites from the "Bottom 100" list... it's just very entertaining and funny throughout, with plenty of cheesy lines and filming/acting goofs along the way 🤣 It's also the very first in a long list of awesome Arnold movies! At least just watch the bear fight scene & you will understand why this movie is vital.

This is such a fun movie! Of course only fun in the sense of being terrible awful. But if you happen to like those crabcake movies, like me, its simply one of the best! The movie shows Arnold in his true form; I mean, he is gigantic! As big as a horse! He is even bigger than when he was shooting Conan the Barbarian. And his English - HAHA! - its fantastic. I'm so glad that I bought this title.I've heard this is Arnolds first movie, though I'm not sure. I think maybe it was the "prize" from winning the Mr. Universe.The best thing in this film, and maybe in every film I have seen, is the awesome actor in that bear costume! I'm laughing just thinking about it! It was so awesome! Cheerio

reviews.review_title: Fantastic--one of the best bad movies I have seen
reviews.content: This is an amazingly bad movie. It's so bad, it is downright hilarious. My friends and I watched this (knowing full well it would absolutely terrible), and within the first two minutes we knew we had a winner. The opening narration had us rolling on the ground. For a while it was just bad, but then there was the fight with a bear, which had escaped from the zoo. First, you hear on the police report that the bear is a "grizzly," one of the largest and most aggressive bears in the US. When the camera pans over the cage where the bear was held, the sign distinctly says "black bear," a much tamer species. Then we actually see the bear. Or, at least I think we do. It looks more like a small ape with a bear's head. Probably because it's a guy in a really horrible bear suit. Ah-nuld proceeds to lay the smack-down. Hilarious scene. And then there is Hercules' sidekick, a Jewish guy named Arnold Stang, and the most stereotypical Jewish character ever. It's terrible, but ironically funny. What's even more strange is that the director and the producer were both presumably Jewish, and yet they wrote in a ridiculously stereotypical Jew.This movie jumps into my number one spot of "Movies that are so bad they are great," leaping over "The Scorpion King."

reviews.review_title: An awful film - but still great to watch
reviews.content: The title itself sums this film up in a nutshell. "Hercules in New York" just screams cheese, low budget and ludicrousy. And that's exactly what you get.As far as the film is concerned, there's probably more goofs than words. The sound is all over the place, and so is the camera! The acting is abysmal (apart from Pluto, he was alright) and Arnie is as stiff as a board.However, I really enjoyed this film. It's silly, it's fun and it's Arnie! If anything it's great to see just how far you think he's come over the years. The unnecessary moments that all Arnie fans are used to, in which he'll decide for no good reason to reveal his phenomenal body structure are as prominent as ever, and this is another plus point for me.It's a bad film, but you cant come away feeling cheated, watch it for what it is.2* for the film. And 3* for Arnie.5/10

Hands down, the best scene is where he picks a fight with a bear in central park and it's real obvious that the bear is a man in a suit.  Verrrry funny Dr. Jones!  Arnold may have been dubbed but he still had the power to insist on two of his weight-lifting buddies being added to the picture.  Their out-of-nowhere fight at the end is amusing as well.

I am a big Arnie fan, have been since I was old enough to operate a V.C.R and I will defend him as charismatic Actor who has been in some brilliant films. However this is not one. Arnold himself would agree. But as a young 22 year old Austrian Bodybuilder's first film it's not his fault at the time he couldn't even speak full English.As a comedy this film is hilarious I just played a little bit of the film for my friend and he fell to the ground laughing at the part where Arnie flys past the plane window. The editing is terrible sound keeps changing per frame (As a film student I would get failed for such sloppiness), the lines are cheesy but funny in an unintentional way and that bear fight.I guess the reason I find it so funny is it reminds me of the half assed films me and my friends have done bored when nobody can act and lines seem stupid.I urge you to watch this film at least once big Arn has come along way.

reviews.review_title: Schwarzenegger's fans must see this movie!
reviews.content: Listen, this is a very entertaining movie. It's hilarious. I laughed my ass off while watching this stupid but very funny movie. I mean, here we have Hercules (Arnold) with a terrible German accent?!? How funny is that??? :)Minor spoiler here: The funniest scene to me was when Arnold fights with a bear who is very poorly animated (You can clearly see that the bear (man that wears the costume) is smaller than Arnie !Nevertheless, I'm a Schwarzenegger fan. I've watched all of his movies and enjoined in single one of them , including this one! Like any other Arnie fan , I strongly recommend for you to watch this movie. I ain't gonna say that this movie is underrated, it's not, but that doesn't mean at all that it's boring , on the contrary , it's very enjoyable to watch! :)

reviews.review_title: If you're looking for a fun, solid movie with unmatched acting skills and great music soundtracks...WATCH THIS!!!!1
reviews.content: What can I say:* It's Arnold * Great music * Great actors * Great story lineIf you're a fan of Arnold Schwarzenegger's movies, or just want to see a movie with a solid story line, this is the movie to watch. It contains tons of humor, but also action and a plot twist! The movie has been shot on great locations: a garden somewhere and of course: The Big Apple!This is a family movie, but I would definitely recommend watching this movie on a first date. Arnold's body has never been more muscular, getting your date all warmed up for the better part of your date.To conclude: A must watch for everyone!

Awful acting and there is nothing else about it.Arnold voice was dubbed then they abandoned that and eventually released it with his original voice. You can't get the dubbed version anymore.He can't act, he can't speak... wtf is he even in movies for...I wish people in charge of these things spend their money on more useful things or AT LEAST hire someone who can act for a change.There are so many talented people yet most movies are filled with people who are not even actors at all.

Entertainment. That's why I gave this movie a high score. Hercules in New york is the kind of movie you can watch with you friend's (if your not up-tight about movies) and laugh. I found Hercules in New York at a video rental agency down the road in a bargain bin, "Arnold's real voice for the first time ever!" It proudly exclaimed. I bought it for £2 ($3) and it was definatly worth the money. It's filled with pointless fights and pointless dialog, in one scene during the film 'Hercules' grabs a fork-lift truck and holds it, then he says "TIS A FINE CHARIOT BUT WARE ARE ZE HOURSES!" Then he lets it go. It's one of those so bad it's funny, much like plan 9 from outer space, accept it doesn't take itself as seriously and is much more enjoyable.I guess what i am trying to say is it's fun, it's silly and it's enjoyable. Buy it cheap if you can.  7/10
